message.content:
Below is one way to “read off” the two little buildings from the photo and match them block‐for‐block to the dictionary (without re‐orienting any piece).  The left “house” uses seven blocks; the right “column‐and‐beam” structure uses six, for a total of thirteen.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Overall there are two separate builds:

  LEFT‐HAND “HOUSE” (7 blocks, stacked in three vertical layers):
  –  Bottom Layer (5 pieces across):
     •  A green horizontal rectangular prism on the far left.  
     •  A red “arch” block in the center.  
     •  A green horizontal rectangular prism on the far right.  
     •  Two red triangular wedges standing at left and right edges (these slope upward from the bottom all the way to the “roof”).  
  –  Middle Layer (1 piece in the center):
     •  A green rectangular block set vertically atop the red arch.  
  –  Top Layer (1 piece):
     •  A single blue cube sitting on the green block, forming the “peak” of the house.  

  RIGHT‐HAND “COLUMNS AND BEAM” (6 blocks, essentially two layers):
  –  Bottom Layer (3 pieces):
     •  Three tall green pillars lined up side‐by‐side as supports.  
  –  Top Layer (3 pieces):
     •  A yellow horizontal bar bridging across the green pillars.  
     •  An orange cylinder standing upright on the yellow bar.  
     •  A yellow half‐cylinder (laid horizontally) perched on top of the orange cylinder.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING DICTIONARY BLOCKS (WITH INDICES)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

●  LEFT “HOUSE”
   1)  #6 (Green, horizontal rectangular prism) – use 2 copies (bottom left & bottom right).  
   2)  #1 (Red arch) – 1 copy (center of bottom).  
   3)  #15 (Red wedge) – 1 copy (left sloping “roof” piece).  
   4)  #16 (Red wedge) – 1 copy (right sloping “roof” piece).  
   5)  #5 (Green, vertical rectangular) – 1 copy (middle layer).  
   6)  #4 (Blue cube) – 1 copy (top “roof” block).  

●  RIGHT “COLUMNS AND BEAM”
   7)  #7 (Green, tall rectangular block) – use 3 copies (the three columns).  
   8)  #9 (Yellow bar) – 1 copy (the horizontal beam).  
   9)  #11 (Orange cylinder) – 1 copy (vertical cylinder on the beam).  
   10) #12 (Yellow half‐cylinder) – 1 copy (on top of the orange cylinder).  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 6   (place first green horizontal block at left of house base)
  Step2:  Move block with index 1   (red arch goes in center of house base)
  Step3:  Move block with index 6   (second green horizontal block at right of house base)
  Step4:  Move block with index 15  (red wedge on left edge, sloping up)
  Step5:  Move block with index 16  (red wedge on right edge, sloping up)
  Step6:  Move block with index 5   (green vertical block on top of red arch)
  Step7:  Move block with index 4   (blue cube at the house’s peak)

  Step8:  Move block with index 7   (first tall green pillar on the right structure)
  Step9:  Move block with index 7   (second tall green pillar)
  Step10: Move block with index 7   (third tall green pillar)
  Step11: Move block with index 9   (yellow horizontal bar across tops of pillars)
  Step12: Move block with index 11  (orange cylinder on top of yellow bar)
  Step13: Move block with index 12  (yellow half‐cylinder capping the orange cylinder)
}

Following those thirteen moves (using each block in the exact orientation shown in the dictionary) reproduces the target arrangement precisely.
